prompt: Why is maximalism the design style consistent with Antifragile principles, and therefore what is the problem with minimalism? How has the rise of minimalism in western design coincided with the rise of the fragile belief that we can know it all?
title: Maximalism, Antifragility, and the Fragility of a Minimalist Mindset
sceneDescription: A sparse living room dominates the frame with stark white walls and a single, precariously thin chair teetering in the center. Tucked off to one side stands an overloaded bookshelf, stuffed with mismatched objects and stacked at irregular angles, yet looking surprisingly sturdy and secure. The lone occupant of the room stands between the chair and the overflowing shelf, hands folded hesitantly, contrasting the fragility of the ultraminimalist centerpiece with the robust chaos behind.
